GcW8lOkp.title: Brief Analysis on the Feature of Deng Xiaoping’s Legal system Ideology
GcW8lOkp.abstract: As an important component part of DengXiaoping’s theory,DengXiaoping’s legal system thinking fully reflects the feature of the times,the feature of China’s own and the feature of socialism.DengXiaoping’s legal system idea has opened up a new prospect for the construction of our country legal system,plays an active part in the legality construction of Chinese characteristic socialism and possesses an important historical status that serves as a link between past and future.

BdKW2DHs.title: On the connotation and characteristic of the development of socialist culture with Chinese characteristics
BdKW2DHs.abstract: The development of socialist culture with Chinese characteristics is a kind of activity of socialist culture creation,an important part of socialist modernization construction of quaternity and an interactional process of the fundamentals of the subject,the object and the measure of the cultural development.The socialist cultural development in China has its own characteristics in the value goal,the subject of development,the key point of development and the road of development.

eltH0E8g.title: STUDY ON ARIMA MODEL OF LD2 ALUMINUM ALLOY ACCELERATED CORROSION PIT EVOLVEMENT
eltH0E8g.abstract: An accelerated corrosion test of aircraft LD2 structure specimen was carried out according to an accelerated corrosion environment spectrum which established by statistically analysing a typical airport environment factor,and the appearance and development of specimen corrosion was viewed as a stochastic process,so the method which was based on time series theory was put forward to depict and forecast the corrosion damage evolvement of LD2 specimen by establishing ARIMA(3,1,1) model with the corrosion pit depths data itself,further more the erected model was applied to analyse the rule of corrosion pit evolvement.The method application results show that the built ARIMA(autoregressive integrated moving average) model can accurately depict the corrosion pit evolvement trend and predict the corrosion pit depth value of LD2 specimen in a prolongation corrosion period,it suggests that time series theory and ARIMA model can be affectively applied in aircraft structure material corrosion prediction research.

pNyniPK3.title: Research on Pit Corrosion Ratio Computation of Aero Aluminum Alloy Material Based on Digital Processing Technique
pNyniPK3.abstract: Accelerated corrosion tests were carried out on LD2 aluminum alloy and corrosion images of the specimen of different corrosion periods were obtained.A series of digital processing technics was applied to analyze the corrosion images and the binarization corrosion images were obtained by the binary characteristic extraction.The pit corrosion ratio of LD2 specimen was calculated based on the obtained binarization corrosion image.The computation results showed that the evolvement of LD2 specimen pit corrosion ratio was better coincidence with the electrochemistry corrosion mechanism of LD2,and the calculation precision of the analysis method is highly better than the traditional pit corrosion ratio calculation method.The purpose was to provide reference for pit corrosion ratio calculation and relative analysis.

Pl8T5E5A.title: Evaluation of Corrosion Damage for 6A02 Aluminum Alloy Based on Fractal Theory
Pl8T5E5A.abstract: Aluminum alloy suffers from corrosion damage in natural environment,which greatly reduces the service life.With the aid of digital image processing technology,fractal theory was introduced to evaluate the corrosion damage parameter,pitting ratio of specimen surface.The proposed method is practical and of engineering value.

Pal6JsRv.title: Research on Fatigue Degradation of Al-Li Alloy with Corrosion Damage
Pal6JsRv.abstract: Al-Li alloy is a newly designed alloy that has a potential in aircraft application.Based on electrochemistry principle,research has been carried on the fatigue properties of Al-Li alloy with corrosion damage,and on the basis of that,fatigue property of Al-Li alloy preetching research was did.The results indicated that low corrosion damage has little effects on the fatigue life of specimen,while the relatively high corrosion damage will remarkably reduce the service life.

LANvVTD1.title: Forecasting Method of Aircraft LY12CZ Structure Corrosion Damage in Airport Environment
LANvVTD1.abstract: Accelerated corrosion test of LY12CZ aluminum alloy was carried out in EXCO solution and the corrosion depth of the alloy was measured.Further more corrosion damage of aircraft LY12CZ structure with different service periods in true airport environment was counted.Based on the corrosion damage data of the two different environments and the corrosion damage equivalent relation,the equivalent relation factor between the EXCO solution and true airport environment was found.Then the neural network model based on EXCO solution test data with the BP algorithm was established.The corrosion damage of aircraft LY12CZ structure in the true airport environment was forecasted with the built model and the equivalent relation factor was found to be 0.023 6 under the two environments.The prediction results showed that the forecasting method is effective and applicable for LY12CZ corrosion damage estimation.

zSRHTDB2.title: Study of Corrosion Fatigue Life of LY12CZ Based on Artificial Neural Network
zSRHTDB2.abstract: BP network model of corrosion time and stress level corresponding to corrosion fatigue life was established through analyzing the obtained corrosion fatigue test data to predict corrosion fatigue life. Newton interpolation was applied to fit the history test data to improve the prediction precision of BP network model,and this way not only made up the deficiency of training data but also fit the data denseness requirement of neural network.The result showed that the BP network model prediction error is little.Using the prediction result to fit the linearity correlation of lgSa and lgN,the fitting result showed that R=0.94～0.99 and slope B=-3.3～-3.4.

qZRNLwaQ.title: Reliability Based Prediction of LY12CZ Aluminum Alloy Residual Strength with Corrosion Damage
qZRNLwaQ.abstract: Specimens of LY12CZ aluminum alloy are exposed in corrosive solution according to ASTM standard with the aim to create pits on specimen surface,which will be later measured to identify the number,the geometric size distribution of the pits by statistical analysis.Single direction tensile tests are conducted on corroded specimen,which proves that residual strength will decrease with corrosion damage increasing.This paper proposed the AFGROW based method to predict the residual strength based on the average pit parameters and maximum pit parameters based on the established physical model.Comparing with the experimental result,the proposed method is proved to be applicable for engineering practice.

frWvpRg2.title: Research on Establishment Method of Local Environmental Spectrum for Navy Aircraft Structure
frWvpRg2.abstract: Lots of local climate environment data of temperature and relative humidity in ground service were obtained by actual measurement,and based on these data,fuzzy cluster analysis was applied to simplify aircraft structure types.When λ=0.7,the clustering result was that aircraft structure has 3 types,which were open,half open,and close.The open type was chosen as example and the liner regression method was applied to establish the forecast model of temperature and humidity of the typical cabin.The obtained model was applied to modify the airport environment spectrum to get the typical structure local environment spectrum.The calculation result showed that the proportion of humidity climate type in local environmental spectrum increases 1.78% to the airport environment spectrum.

Aye0A0R3.title: Study on Corrosion Damage and Calendar Life Prediction of LY12CZ Aluminum Alloy Based on Neural Network
Aye0A0R3.abstract: A neural network model for mapping the accelerated corrosion time and maximum corrosion depths of LY12CZ was established.The neural network model was trained with the test data until the model achieved the required precision.The model was used to predict the LY12CZ corrosion damage and calculate the equivalent factor k between accelerated test and true airbase environmental test based on prediction results and equivalent relationship of corrosion,the result is k=2,so the calen- dar life(a) of LY12CZ in the true airbase environment equal to the accelerated corrosion time(d) multiply 2.

XQqFETIU.title: Comparative Study of Aircraft Aluminum Alloy Structure Corrosion Damage Forecasting Methods
XQqFETIU.abstract: 3 corrosion damage forecasting methods were put forward based on accelerated corrosion test data of LD2 structural material of aircraft,which were data fitting,neural network,and time series methods.Basic forecasting principle,forecasting accuracy,and forecasting extension of the 3 prediction methods were compared and analyzed.The result showed that the prediction accuracy of neural network and time series method are higher than data fitting method;the prediction extensionality of time series method is the best,which can predict the value and development trend of aluminum alloy corrosion depths in a future period with higher precision.It was suggested that appropriate forecasting method should be selected based on the need of prediction research.

EMtsHlKj.title: Research on Effects of Temperature on Fatigue Short Crack Initiation Behaviour for Aluminum Alloy
EMtsHlKj.abstract: Based on scanning electron microscopy(SEM) in-situ observation,the fatigue short crack initiation and early stage propagation behavior was studied when subjected to cycling stress and temperature.Results indicated temperature played an important role.A formula to characterize fatigue short crack initiation life for specimen under elevated temperature was proposed based on the local strain method.

FaogLAUW.title: Fatigue Damage Evaluation of Aluminum Alloy Based on Energy Degradation
FaogLAUW.abstract: Through single direction tensile testing for LY12CZ aluminum alloy at three different stress levels,the energy degradation was found to be closely related to the material damage.So based on the viewpoint of energy,a new method was proposed to evaluate fatigue damage of aluminum alloy,which is promising for fatigue life prediction of aircraft aluminum alloy structure.
FaogLAUW.venue: Physical Testing and Chemical Analysis(Part A:Physical Testing)

HtKMkkYF.title: Electrical Resistance Method based Fatigue Damage Characterization for Aluminum Alloy
HtKMkkYF.abstract: The present thesis proposed a damage parameter to characterize fatigue damage accumulation of aluminum alloy based on electrical resistance.A theoretical formula to predict the residual fatigue life of damaged specimen is established based on the measurement of the damaged specimen.Experimental data from aluminum alloy 6A02 agreed well with the theoretical results adopting the proposed model in this paper especially for high-cycle fatigue of aluminum alloy.Although the prediction precision of proposed model is relatively limited for low cycle fatigue of aluminum alloy,the resistance based fatigue damage prediction model proposed in this thesis still showed a promising engineering application,which needs further improvement.

XasPcV0A.title: Diagnostic Expert System for Hydraulic System of Aircraft Based on CLIPS
XasPcV0A.abstract: The necessary is expatiated that is the erect the diagnostic expert system for the hydraulic system of aircraft,and then the introduced CLIPS that is an expert system developing platform based on C language,described its exploitation procedure of the fault diagnostic expert system of hydraulic system of aircraft based on CLIPS.The expert system could diagnose the faults automatically based on certain phenomena of faults in the hydraulic system and is practical for analyzing,diagnosing and obviating the fault.

3Mk5T8w3.title: Cluster Analysis of Structure Type of Military Aircraft
3Mk5T8w3.abstract: 16 typical structure types of certain aircraft were analyzed.Local temperature and relative humidity were measured in two months period and 673 effective data were collected.The structure types were analyzed with fuzzy cluster analysis algorithm.The results showed that when =0.7,the structure types of aircraft can be classified as open,half open,and close types.

Kef1nL4B.title: Corrosion Behavior Investigation of LD2 Aluminum Alloy
Kef1nL4B.abstract: LD2 aluminum alloy is widely applied in helicopter structures,which will suffer from environmental corrosion damage during service.Thus,the service life will be greatly decreased.So it is essential to evaluate corrosion behavior of this alloy.SEM and energy spectrum analysis were used to characterize the corrosion behavior of aluminum alloy in micro-scale.Tunnel beneath the corrosion pit was discovered on the fatigue fracture surface of specimen,which will lead to underestimation of corrosion pit depth and uncertainty of structure service life estimation.

9Hc8zb94.title: Fatigue Crack Growth of LD10CZ Aluminum Alloy with Pre-Corrosion Based on Micro-Crack
9Hc8zb94.abstract: Corrosion fatigue is a form of damage subjected to combined damage of fatigue stress and corrosive me dium.Experimental investigations on prior corrosion fatigue cracking behavior of LD10CZ were conducted with the aid of scanning electron microscope(SEM).Results indicate that corrosion damage was important for the fa tigue cracking behavior of AA LD10CZ.

4qt3MLLb.title: Evaluation of Fatigue Initial Life for 2A12 Aluminum Alloy with Pre-corrosion Using Two Parameter Weibull Model
4qt3MLLb.abstract: Aluminum alloy is widely used in aviation industry, which makes it a key issue to evaluate the life aluminum components. Corrosion damage will favor crack initiation, and thus outstandingly decrease fatigue life of aluminum structure. Fatigue crack initiation life takes up most of the whole fatigue life of aluminum structure during service, making it key to evaluate effect of corrosion damage on crack initiation. Too many factors will influence corrosion combined fatigue behavior, scatters of experimental data prevail. So it is necessary to introduce weibull model to evaluate the fatigue cracking behavior, which makes the proposed method applicable for damage tolerance assessment.

9bjGrn8J.title: Study on Corrosion Damage Probability Distribution Law of Aluminum-Lithium Alloy Based on Accelerated Corrosion Test
9bjGrn8J.abstract: Immersion corrosion test of 1420 aluminum-lithium alloy was carried out in EXCO solution;corrosion depth data was obtained;statistical study of corrosion depth was carried out based on the data.The results showed that the corrosion depth obeys Gumbel distribution,Normal distribution,Weibull distribution and Log-Normal distribution.The kinetics laws of corrosion were established according to the corrosion depths data.The kinetics laws showed that the corrosion behavior can be divided into two stages.In the earlier stage,corrosion rate is slower,in the later stage,corrosion rate is faster.During the two stages the kinetics law of 1420 aluminum-lithium alloy corrosion behavior in EXCO solution approximately follows a linear law.

jM7K5Rq6.title: Forecasting Research on Aero-engine Rotate Speed Signal Based on ARMA Model
jM7K5Rq6.abstract: This paper presents a method to analyze and forecast the rotate speed signal of one type of aero-engine that is based on time series theory by modeling ARMA model,and establishes ARMA(3,1) model to predict the value and transfformation trend of rotate speed signal.The application results show that the erected ARMA(3,1) model can simulate rotate speed signal series quite well with good prediction accuracy,so it suggests that the method which is based on time series and ARMA model can be affectively and applicably used in aero-engine condition monitoring and fault diagnosis.

xnrb5V7V.title: Evaluation of Fatigue Initial Life for Aluminum Alloy with Pre-corrosion
xnrb5V7V.abstract: Aluminum alloy is widely used in aviation industry,which makes it a key issue to evaluate the life aluminum components.Fatigue crack initiation and early stage propagation behavior of pre-corroded aluminum alloy under stress cycle was studied using scanning electron microscopy(SEM) in-situ observation.Results indicated that corrosion pit has significant influence on fatigue crack initiation and early stage propagation.A formula to evaluate the small fatigue crack initiation life of aluminum alloy with different corrosion damage was proposed based on local strain method.

6QSsUSrW.title: Corrosion Fatigue Fracture Analysis of LY12CZ Aluminum Alloy
6QSsUSrW.abstract: Fatigue fracture surface of AA LY12CZ with corrosion damage was studied using scanning electron microscope and energy spectrum analysis.The effect of fatigue fracture feature,alloy element Si and Mg,and the corrosion damage on the fracture process was analyzed.The results indicated that the fatigue fracture surface is tough fracture with multiple fatigue sources;pits introduced by corrosion damage weaken the material property,which serve as crack nucleation sites;proper hardening constituent element introduced during alloying process such as Si and Mg,will make strength and plasticity match,thus improve fatigue performance of materials.

rlUM8fkd.title: Equivalent relation of aero aluminum alloy corrosion based on corrosion grade
rlUM8fkd.abstract: With LY12CZ aluminum alloy specimens as research object and the corrosion grade as measurement parameter, the equivalent relation factor was obtained by carring out accelerated corrosion testing of LY12CZ specimens and actually measuring the LY12CZ structure corrosion damage in airport environment. Through calculation, the equivalent relation factor k between accelerated corrosion and airport environment corrosion was 0. 95. The relationship between corrosion year and corrosion grade of LY12CZ in airport environment was further established. The validity and rationality of the equivalent relation were validated through contrast with measurement of the aircraft LY12CZ structure corrosion damage and analysis of correlative literature.

TaqOkFDt.title: Markov Chain Model based Characterization of Corrosion Fatigue Crack Growth of aluminum alloy
TaqOkFDt.abstract: This paper proposes a rather universal stochastic Markov chain model to characterize corrosion fatigue data based the scatter and statistical nature of fatigue crack growth.The model gives us the crack length distribution probabilities in certain stress cycles.Through comparison between the analytical results and experimental data,it is found that the model can fit the experimental data rather well.It can be used for the prediction of fatigue life and reliability of aircraft structures made of the tested material.

U2TqJuCU.title: Grey Correlation Research on Atmospheric Corrosion Environment Factors of Aircraft LY12CZ Aluminum Alloy
U2TqJuCU.abstract: The atmospheric environment causing atmospheric corrosion of aircraft LY12CZ structure is viewed as a grey system.The weather and medium environment factor data of typical climate territories were statistically analyzed to calculate the atmospheric corrosion rale data of aircraft LY12CZ aluminum alloy in different corrosion years.The grey correlation of environment factors was analyzed based on grey system theory with the aim to quantitatively analyze the influence degree of different environment factors on the atmospheric corrosion rate of LY12CZ.The analysis results show that the number of fog days and the Cl concentration are the strongest inflence factors on the atmospheric corrosion rate of LY12CZ among all the weather and medium environment factors.

dANzKZtv.title: Syntheses and cofluorescence of complexes of Eu(Ⅲ)/Y(Ⅲ) with terephthalic acid, 2-thenoyltrifluoroacetone and trioctylphosphine oxide
dANzKZtv.abstract: A series of Eu( Ⅲ )/Y( Ⅲ ) complexes of terephthalic acid(TPA) with 2-thenoyltrifluoroacetone(HTTA) and trioctylphosphine oxide(TPPO) were synthesized. Compositions of these complexes are revealed to be Eu2(1-x)Y2x(TPA)(TTA)4- (TPPO)4 or Eu1-xYx(TPA)(TTA)(TPPO)2. Their IR spectra, fluorescent spectra and the thermal and optical stability were studied. The fluorescent excitation spectra of these complexes show more broad excitation bands than those of Eu2(TPA)3(TPPO)4 and Eu(TTA)3(TPPO)2 corresponding to their formations. In addition, both the binuclear complex EuY(TPA)(TTA)4(TPPO)4 and the chain complex Eu0.4Y0.6(TPA)(TTA)(TPPO)2 present higher thermal stability and better optical stability than the mononuclear complex Eu(TTA)3(TPPO)2 does. And their thermal and optical stabilities are preferably interpreted from the binuclear structure together with the chain polynuclear structure of the complexes. The fluorescence enhancement of cofluorescence Y3+ ions to the Eu(Ⅲ) complexes is clear. The optimum content of Y3+ is 0.6 (molar fraction) for the chain complexes Eu1-xYx(TPA)(TTA)- (TPPO)2 and 0.5 for the binuclear complexes Eu2(1-x)Y2x(TPA)(TTA)4(TPPO)4. The formation of polynuclear structure of the complex Eu1-xYx(TPA)(TTA)(TPPO)2 appears to be responsible for the good cofluorescence effect of Y3+ ions.

JPGmD35E.abstract: In order to improve the quality in organic chemistry teaching,the designs of the teaching system,classroom teaching,keystone and difficulty teaching have been explored in the paper.The improvement of teaching will not only help students master the knowledge and its application easily,but also promote the self-access learning ability and innovation capabilities of the students.

VsZ3KAh1.title: First-principle investigation on stability of Co-doped spinel λ-Mn_(4-x)Co_xO_8
VsZ3KAh1.abstract: The mechanism of stability of Co-doped spinel λ-MnO_2 that is referred to as spinel Li_xMn_2O_4 (x=0) was studied by using the first-principle calculation method. The total energy and formation enthalpy can be decreased remarkably due to the Co substation, resulting in a more stable structure of λ-Mn_xCr_(2-x)O_4. The bond order and DOS analysis were given in detail to explain the nature of stability improvement. The calculated results show that as the content of Co dopant increases, the bond order of Mn—O becomes larger and the peak of density of states around Fermi level shifts toward lower energy. The charge density distribution illustrates that the Mn—O bonding is ionic and partially covalent, and the covalent Mn-O bonding becomes stronger with the increase of Co dopant content. The results confirm that the Codoping will enhance the stability of λ-MnO_2 and hence improve the electrochemistry performance of Li_xMn_2O_4.

TxvoNNpc.title: Research on Fluorescent Properties and Syntheses of Complexes of Eu(III)/Gd(III) with P-Methoxybenzoic Acid, α-Thenoyltrifluoroacetone and Phenanthroline
TxvoNNpc.abstract: A series of complexes of Eu(III)/Gd(III) with p-methoxybenzoic acid(POA),α-thenoyltrifluoro-acetone(HTTA) and Phenanthroline(Phen) were synthesized.These complexes were characterized by elemental analysis,IR spectrum,scanning electronic microscope.Their compositions are revealed to be Eu1-xGdx(POA)(TTA)2Phen(x=0～1).The fluores-cent excitation spectrum of the complex Eu(POA)(TTA)2Phen is different from those of the complexes Eu(TTA)3Phen and Eu(POA) 3Phen,and shows a peak position blue shift than that of Eu(TTA)3Phen,which corresponds to the formation of the complex.The fluorescence enhancement of cofluorescence Gd3+ ions to the Eu(III) complexes is clear.The optimum concentration of Gd3+ is 0.4(molar fraction).The intermolecular energy transfer between Gd(POA)(TTA)2Phen and Eu(POA)(TTA)2Phen ap-pears to be responsible for the fluorescence enhancement of Eu1-xGdx(POA)(TTA)2Phen.

J7J8AN6z.abstract: Based on the course characteristics of Principle of Chemical Engineering,compared the teaching differences between multimedia teaching and the traditional teaching with blackboard and chalk.After analysising the advantages of multimedia teaching,supposed that making multimedia teaching wares should go by the following four general principles,that was helping to realize converting of the roles between teachers and students,teaching contents,media function and teaching process structures.

JhGkazpt.title: Studies on the Synthesis and Correlative Performance of Complexes of Eu(Ⅲ) with Trimellitic Acid,HTTA and Phen
JhGkazpt.abstract: Two new complexes of Eu(Ⅲ) with trimellitic acid(TLA),α-thenoyltrifluoroacetone(HTTA) and phenanthroline(Phen) were synthesized.The complexes were characterized by elemental analysis,IR spectroscopy,scanning electronic microscopy and fluorescent spectra.The experimental result showed that two new complexes of Eu(Ⅲ) with TLA,HTTA and Phen showed stronger fluorescence and more broad of UV excitation than the complex of Eu(Ⅲ) with TLA and Phen did,and better thermal stability than the complex Eu(TTA)3 Phen did.Two sharp red fluorescent materials with good thermal stability have been obtained.

LzAYRSGa.title: Studies on Cofluorescence of Eu(III)/Gd(III) in Complexes of 2-Thienyltrifluoroacetonate/Terephthalic Acid and Phenanthroline
LzAYRSGa.abstract: In order to investigate the relationship between cofluorescence and the structure of the Eu (III) complexes, a series of europium (III)/gadolimum(III) complexes of 2-thienyltrifluoroacetonate(TTA)/terephthalic acid(TPA) and phenanthroline(Phen) have been synthesized. These complexes were characterized by elemental analysis and infrared spectra analysis. The fluorescence enhancement of Gd3+ ions to the Eu(III) complexes is clear. The effect of Gd3+ ion cofluorescence in the Eu(III) complexes increases in the following order: the mononuclear complex Eu1-xGdx(TTA)3Phen, the chain polynuclear complex Eu1-xGdx(TPA)(TTA)Phen, the net polynuclear complex Eu2(1-x)Gd2x(TPA)3Phen2, which clearly establishes a correlation between the structure of the Eu(III) complexes and the effect of cofluorescence for the first time. The mechanism of cofluorescence in the above-mentioned Eu(III) complexes is preferably interpreted from the mononuclear and polynuclear structure of these complexes. Intra molecular energy transfer in the cross polynuclear complexes EU1-xGdx(TPA)(TTA)Phen and Eu2(1-x)Gd2x(TPA)3Phen2 is more efficient than intermolecular energy transfer between cross mononuclear complexes Eu1-xGdx(TTA)3Phen.

x0psp4dI.title: Syntheses and applications of Eu(III) complexes of 2-thienyltrifluoroacetonate, terephthalic acid and phenanthroline as light conversion agents
x0psp4dI.abstract:
A series of europium(III) complexes of 2-thienyltrifluoroacetonate (HTTA), terephthalic acid (TPA) and phenanthroline (Phen)
 were synthesized. The new complexes Eu(TPA)(TTA)Phen and Eu2(TPA)(TTA)4Phen2 were characterized by elemental analysis, IR spectrum, scanning electron microscope and thermal stability analysis. The results
 show that the thermal stability of the Eu(III) complexes increases in the following order: the mononuclear complex Eu(TTA)3Phen, the binuclear complex Eu2(TPA)(TTA)4Phen2, the chain polynuclear complex Eu(TPA)(TTA)Phen. And the formation of the binuclear/polynuclear structure of the new complexes
 appears to be responsible for the enhancement of their thermal and optical stability. In addition, The fluorescence excitation
 spectra of these new complexes show more broad excitation bands than that of the complex Eu(TTA)3Phen corresponding to their formation. The enhancement of Eu3+ fluorescence in the new complexes can be observed by the addition of Gd3+. The bright red luminescent plastics can be obtained when the complex EuGd(TPA)(TTA)4Phen2 is added above 0.5% (mass fraction).

DLrAdlSt.title: Fluorescence enhancement of europium Ⅲ-terephthalic acid-2-thenoyltrifluoroacetone polynuclear system and its application
DLrAdlSt.abstract: Fluorescence enhancement of europium Ⅲ in ethanol solution was studied with terephthalic acid(TPA) and 2-thenoyltrifluoroacetone(HTTA) as ligands.The results indicated that,the sensibilization of TPA-HTTA mixed ligand enhanced the fluorescence intensity of Eu3+ by more than three orders of magnitude in ethanol solution at pH 6.8.In the presence of triphenylphosphine oxide(TPPO),the formed multi-nuclear luminescence system between rare earths(La3+,Gd3+,Y3+) and Eu3+-TPA-TTA-TPPO had strong luminous effect.Based on this fact,a new determination method for trace europium in rare earth samples was established.The linear range of method was 4.0×10-8-3.0×10-6 mol/L with detection limit of 6.0×10-10 mol/L.This system was applied to the analysis of four synthesized rare earth mixture samples with relative error of 1.7 %-3.8 % and relative standard deviation(RSD) of 1.7 %-3.5 %.

2mh32252.title: Applications of Genetic Algorithms on 2D-QSAR Analysis of Schiff Bases of Hydroxysemicarbazide as Ribonucleotide Reductase Inhibitors
2mh32252.abstract: Quantitative structure-activity relationships(QSARs) for 30 Schiff Bases of Hydroxysemicarbazide were studied.By using genetic algorithm(GA),a group of multiple regression models with high fitness scores and high predictabilities(R2,Rcv2 were up to 0.909 and 0.883,respectively) were generated.From the statistical analyses of the descriptors used in the evolution procedure,three of them,including the partition coefficient(APlog98),indicator(I),E-State key(sums)(S_sOH) were found to be the principal features affecting the biological activity,which supplies a guide for the design and reconstruction of new Ribonucleotide Reductase Inhibitors.

M3SsaGyD.title: Fluorescence Enhancement of Europium (Ⅲ)-Trimellitic Acid System and Its Application to the Determination of Europium
M3SsaGyD.abstract: By the method of comparative analysis of fluorescence spectra,fluorescence enhancement of europium(Ⅲ) was studied in aqueous solution with trimellitic acid(benzene-1,2,4-tricarboxylic acid(TLA)) as ligands.The results showed that the ligand sensitized improved the fluorescence intensity three orders of magnitude in aqueous solution at pH 6.3,and with surfactant TritonX-100 in aqueous solution at pH 6.7,rare earth La3+ increased the fluorescence intensity furtherly about two orders of magnitude.Both intermolecular and intra molecular energy transfer modes were applied to explain the cofluorescence mechanism of the system under the different test conditions.In the optimum determining conditions,when Eu3+ concentration was in the range of 6.7×10-8～5.0×10-6 mol/L,it had a linear relation with the fluorescence intensity of Eu3+-La3+-TLA-TritonX-100 system,and the limit of Eu3+ in the system was detected to be 8.0×10-9 mol/L.

yLmDXFIV.title: Study on Quantitative Structure–Activity Relationship of Pyrazole-based Inhibitors of the Transformation Growth Factor-β Type Ⅰ Receptor Kinase Domain
yLmDXFIV.abstract: The geometry structure of pyrazole-based inhibitors of the transformation growth factor-β type Ⅰ receptor kinase domain(Tβ R-Ⅰ) was optimized by means of quantum chemistry,molecular mechanism and molecular anneal dynamics.The quantitative structure-activity relationship of these inhibitors in regard to TβR-Ⅰ was systematically studied using the genetic function approximation(GFA) and multiple linear regression(MLR).Some main independent factors affecting the activity of the compounds were selected out,and then the QSAR equation was established.It has found that the square of y component of total dipole moment of molecule(μy)2,the net charge of the nitrogen atom of quinolin QN3,and Jurs descriptor RNCS— Relative negative charge surface area,are the main independent factors contributing to the inhibiting activity of the compounds.The fitting correlation coefficient R2,the cross-validation Rcv2,the standard error of the regression model s and F test value F for the model established by this study are,0.834,0.576,0.243 and 13.439,respectively.The results suggest that this model has good predictability.
keywords: The transformation growth factor-β type Ⅰ receptor kinase domain(Tβ R-Ⅰ)

xfojSt9t.title: Study on Electrochemical Immunosensor Construction Based on New Carbon Paste Electrode Using Polyvinyl Alcohol-Doped Polystyrene as Adhesive
xfojSt9t.abstract: A new strategy to constructing amperometric immunosensor for transferrin assay based on improved carbon paste electrode(CPE) as sensing platform has been described.The CPE is prepared by employing polyvinyl alcohol-doped polystyrene as the novel adhesive.The obtained CPE has good conductivity and better surface-adsorption capability.A sequential competitive immunoassay format was performed on the surface of CPE by using transferrin and transferrin antibody as a model system.The assay comprised first loading of the transferrin antibody on surface of CPE,then blocked in BSA solution followed by a competitive incubation in the buffer containing the transferrin(analyte) and transferrin labeled with horseradish peroxidase(SjAg-HRP) and finally the amperometric detection.The feasibility of regenerating surface of CPE for consecutive assays is demonstrated by a simple polish after each determination.The dynamic concentration range for transferrin assay is 0.50～70.0 μg/mL.

ok4sXzNe.abstract: Objective To design an integrated information system for NBC medical rescue.Methods The configuration,components,integration techniques and methods for the information system were explored,with the flow,technologies and equipment for NBC medical rescue introduced.Results The information on command,medicine and support was integrated into the system,and thus the support efficiency was enhanced greatly.Conclusion The system contributes a lot to the informatization of NBC medical rescue.

2mrPLcMo.title: Design of Supervision and Control System for Micro-environment in Compartment Based upon CAN Bus
2mrPLcMo.abstract: Objective To develop the CAN bus-based supervision and control system for the micro-environment in the compartment,to satisfy its requirements for temperature,pressure,humidity.Methods CAN bus technology was used to realize the supervision & control of micro-environment in the compartment,and CP2200 Ethernet interface chip was also applied to the design of the Ethernet network interface,which made any computer in the net able to supervise and control micro-environment for long distance.Results The system,besides remote supervision and control through Ethernet network interface,could also be used for filed monitoring.Conclusion It can improve the capability of long-distance supervision & control and the informatization level of military medical equipment.

pe8khaTB.title: Research and Development on Digital Temperature Recorder System of Vehicle-mounted Blood Bank Based on ATmega48
pe8khaTB.abstract: Objective To research and develop a new type of temperature recorder system of vehicle-mounted blood bank which is used in the field training and combat. Methods Based on ATmega48 SCM as control core, the components including digital temperature recorder, LCD, buzzer and so on are used. Results The recorder can not only monitor temperature and display real-time, but also store the data in the recorder of the serial EEPROM (CAT24C64). Additionally, when the temperature exceeds the given range, it can be automatic alarm. Conclusion The temperature recorder with a short collection cycle, the record for a long time and high sensitivity, cost-effective, small size and easy to carry, etc., can be widely used in medicine, food, chemicals, electronic manufacturing, warehousing, logistics, as well as agriculture and other sectors.

XmhMgIoI.title: Study and Design of Room Minipressure Control System for Medical Vehicle
XmhMgIoI.abstract: Objective To develop room minipressure control system for medical vehicle to meeting the requirements for the pressure measuring and controlling of the compartment environment.Methods Sensor,motor,valve decided and controller for room minipressure control system were selected.The pressure measuring data management system was set up and the room minipressure control system was designed with the realization of controlling the compartment pressure quickly and accurately.Results The room minipressure control system can control the compartment pressure accurately and quickly.Conclusion In the light of the function of the different compartments,the room minipressure control system can control the compartment pressure quickly and effectively,which can satisfy the requirements of the operation and improve the human thermal comfort.

1YfxEsOh.abstract: Objective To design a medical service vehicle to be used as the medical command & information system support platform of the shelter hospital for Chinese People's Armed Police Forces.Methods Information equipment integration and vehicle modification were performed,with the shortcomings of the existing shelter hospital analyzed.Results The medical service vehicle could be used for field operation,communication,audio & video monitoring as well as tele-consultation.Conclusion The medical service vehicle is gifted with complete functions,and thus can provide reference for other like ones.

HphHpWZC.abstract: A large amount of mechanical and electrical equipment are used for improving the function of mobile medical compartment,and the complex HVAC system are designed for improving the comfortability of the compartment.So the noise level may be decreased.It may induce the efficiency decreasing and hearing loss of medical personal.It is important to control the noise level in system engineering designed for medical compartment.Active and passive noise control methods are used in device selecting,structure designing,new isolated material using and noise maintaining.Hearing protection devices are recommended for crew in high noise environment,remote monitoring is used for decreasing time exposure to noise.The noise level in mobile medical compartment reaches standard for effective noise control,so hearing injury and disability payment losing decreased.

67t1oQId.title: Development of an overpressure and negative-pressure bioprotection system with function of bioaerosol filtration
67t1oQId.abstract: Objective:To design and produce an overpressure and negative-pressure biofiltration system for emergency ambulance and evaluate its protective effects against bioaerosol contamination.Methods:The overpressure filtration unit, negative-pressure filtration unit,protection control unit and monitor-alarm unit were designed jointly with modularization methods,which provided the emergency ambulance with effective bioprotection,such as the real time monitor for the work- ing status of the air filters and the timely alarm in case of invalidation.Results:The tests showed that the bioprotection sys- tem could realize an overpressure not less than 300 pascals with the microbial aerosol filtration efficiency over 99.95% and the negative-pressure not higher than-70 pascals with the microbial aerosol filtration efficiency over 99.93% for the com- partment.Conclusion:The bioprotection system can allow the ambulance to carry the patients and wounded safely through the contaminated area and prevent the outside environment from biological contamination when the ambulance carries biolog- ically contaminated patients or infectious patients.

Q6LZ5olu.title: Design of an anesthesia and micro-environment information management system in mobile operating room]
Q6LZ5olu.abstract: We have designed a mobile operating room information management system. The system is composed of a client and a server. A client, consisting of a PC, medical equipments, PLC and sensors, provides the acquisition and processing of anesthesia and micro-environment data. A server is a powerful computer that stores the data of the system. The client gathers the medical device data by using the C/S mode, and analyzes the obtained HL7 messages through the class library call. The client collects the micro-environment information with PLC, and finishes the data reading with the OPC technology. Experiment results showed that the designed system could manage the patient anesthesia and micro-environment information well, and improve the efficiency of the doctors' works and the digital level of the mobile operating room.

YIH45KcG.title: Research on Information System of Mobile Hospital Based on Shelter
YIH45KcG.abstract: Objective To research a set of information system to improve the ability of rescue on mobile hospital. Methods The industry server and shelter client were used for establishing the network system of medical information, which used telemedicine in satellite communication, analyzed hardware topology and software demand. The measures of increasing safety and reliability were provided. Results The medical information was transmitted by network to share; the transmitting speed of remote diagnosis was 768Kb/s and dynamic image in 25 frame per second. Conclusion The level of the hospital informationization was improved for designing the IMS in modular thought.

J6DQH7aq.title: Research of air heater fault diagnosis based on Fuzzy theory
J6DQH7aq.abstract: This paper describes the basic theories and means of fuzzy logic fault diagnosis. Aiming at the faults that appears in air heater,the fuzzy relation matrix used for its fault diagnosis is constructed. Based on that,the air heater fault diagnosis examples are given. Application results show that it is feasible to apply the method of fuzzy diagnosis to diagnose air heater faults and the method is simple and valid.

DrglkS2L.title: Study and Design of Emergency Mobile Hospital for Chinese People's Armed Police Forces
DrglkS2L.abstract: Objective To develop a shelter hospital for Chinese People's Armed Police Forces to perform rescue of emergencies and disaster for either comprehensive use or only physical examination at corners.Methods The expansion mode with the plate pushed and pulled manually was used to develop the shelter hospital,with the shortcomings of the existing hospital analyzed.Results The shelter hospital was composed of eight shelter units,two support vehicles,passing tent,ward tent and etc,which was gifted with a extended treatment scope and enhanced treatment ability.Conclusion The shelter hospital for Chinese People's Armed Police Forces can meet the requirements for multiple medical support,and thus gains its significance for maintaining social stability.

Ay0k4464.title: Design of the mobile hospital network
Ay0k4464.abstract: Objective To design and optimize the mobile hospital information system network.Methods Based on analysis of hospital information system networks,and with reference to features of a mobile hospital,a secure communications network is set up which can spread rapidly.Results Use of this mobile hospital information system network in wartime mobile hospital information system enables electronic medical record system,laboratory information system(LIS),picture archiving and communicating system(PACS),radiological information system(RIS),telemedicine and other functions.Conclusion A mobile hospital information network is designed that can improve the information level of mobile hospitals in China.

IY3y4HrG.title: Application and Prospect of Wireless Net Technology in Medical Equipment
IY3y4HrG.abstract: Objective To apply wireless net technology in our military's medical equipment more effectually. asStRWhX.title: Application of CAN-bus in Medical Vehicle
asStRWhX.abstract: Objective Nowadays,with the development of medical vehicle,there are many parameters for inspection in its interior.It has disadvantages,such as complex routing and low system reliability,to use DCS.CAN bus technology can decrease routing and enhance system reliability.Methods OPC technology was used.A temperature supervisor control program and a database application were designed by VB,and the temperature was control by the fuzzy control methods.Results The temperature supervisor control system was established with CAN bus to explore the application of CAN bus in the medical vehicle.Conclusion It can enhance the system's reliability to use CAN bus technology in the medical vehicle.

pW6SN1HY.title: Effects of nonstoichiometry on the properties of electron-doped manganite Pr0.1Ca0.9MnO3
pW6SN1HY.abstract: Mn 4+ -rich perovskite manganites (nominal composition: Pr 0.1 Ca 0.9 MnO 3 ) were synthesized by using a citric acid method and sintered at different temperatures (800, 900, 1000, and 1300 °C) to adjust the concentration of charge carrier. All the samples are found to be in the cluster glass state at low temperature, as indicated by dc and ac magnetization. With the increase of sintering temperature, the ferromagnetic component in samples increases at first, and attains a maximum at 1000 °C, then decreases again at 1300 °C, which could be well interpreted by the change of charge carrier concentration induced by nonstoichiometry, consistent with the trend on the phase diagram. However, nonstoichiometry breaks long-range Mn–O–Mn interaction, resulting in the variance from the phase diagram. PACS 75.47.Lx 75.50 73.22.−f Keywords Manganite Ferromagnetism Cluster glass 1 Introduction Hole-doped manganites with a perovskite structure have attracted much attention in recent years. On the contrary, a little work has been devoted to electron-doped manganites, which also exhibit rich physical phenomena. Among the interesting phenomena, colossal magnetoresistance (CMR) effect is of great importance because of its potential applications in the electronic industry. Different from the hole-doped side, CMR is observed only in a narrow range of compositions for electron-doped manganites [1–3] , as indicated by the phase diagram of Pr 1− x Ca x MnO 3 [4] . It is noteworthy that the physical properties of the Pr 1− x Ca x MnO 3 system are sensitive to the concentration of charge carrier near x= 0.9, where a transition from antiferromagnetic insulating state, concomitant with charge ordering to cluster glass, occurs, and the CMR effect is observed as well. The properties of manganites are significantly influenced by three factors, which are namely concentration of charge carrier, average A-site cationic radius 〈 r A 〉 and A-site cationic size mismatch [5–8] . Alkaline earth element doping is usually used to adjust the ratio of Mn 3+ /Mn 4+ ; however, the variations of 〈 r A 〉 and A-site cationic size mismatch are introduced at the same time. Fortunately, oxygen nonstoichiometry can be used to adjust the concentration of charge carrier without changing 〈 r A 〉 and A-site cationic size mismatch. Oxygen nonstoichiometry was found in the Pr 1− x Ca x MnO 3 system synthesized by the conventional solid-state reaction technique [9,10] . As for LaMnO 3+ δ prepared by the sol–gel method, the content of oxygen was adjusted by sintering the precursor powder at different temperatures [11] . In order to trace the effect of the concentration of charge carrier on electron-doped manganites, Pr 0.1 Ca 0.9 MnO 3 was synthesized by a citric acid method. Different sintering temperatures were adopted to regulate the oxygen content of single-component Pr 0.1 Ca 0.9 MnO 3 , with the same 〈 r A 〉 and A-site cationic size mismatch, so that the properties of materials can be controlled separately by the concentration of charge carrier. 2 Experimental Stoichiometric amounts of Pr 6 O 11 were dissolved in citric acid, then mixed with required amounts of Ca(NO 3 ) 2 ·4H 2 O and Mn(NO) 3 in distilled water to form a solution with a concentration of 0.05 mol/L. After that, citric acid was added to the solution in the molar ratio of 1:1 to the cations. The solution was then stirred and heated at 70 °C until a gel was formed. The resulted gel was evaporated in an oven at 120 °C for 6 h to yield a dry powder. Finally, it was pelletized and sintered at 800, 900, 1000 and 1300 °C for 12 h. For simplicity, the above samples are denoted as PCM800, PCM900, PCM1000 and PCM1300, respectively. The ratio between Pr(Ca) and Mn in the materials was determined using a JOEL JXA 8800 L electron microprobe microanalyzer. Oxygen contents of all samples were determined by iodometric titration. The results are shown in Table 1 . It is evident that element manganese and oxygen nonstoichiometry occurs during the preparation. Oxygen loss increases with sintering temperature, while manganese loss is almost constant. X-ray diffraction (XRD) patterns were collected using a Bede D 1 X-ray diffractometer with Ni-filtered Cu K α radiation. The magnetic properties were measured using the quantum design physical properties measurement system (PPMS). The samples were first cooled to 10 K under zero-field (zero-field cooling (ZFC)) and an applied field (field cooling (FC)), then the data were collected during the warming process. Magnetic hysteresis loops were measured at 10 K. Under the ZFC process, ac susceptibility measurement for the samples was performed. 3 Results and discussion All the samples are found to be in the single orthorhombic phase with a perovskite structure, as confirmed by XRD patterns shown in Fig. 1 , with the peaks indexed. The grain sizes ( D ) derived from Scherrer's Equation are shown in Table 1 . Obviously, the grain size increases with increasing sintering temperature. Fig. 2 shows the temperature dependence of dc magnetization for all the samples under the ZFC and FC conditions. For samples sintered at relatively lower temperatures (PCM800, PCM900, PCM1000), FC curves exhibit a “Brillouin-like” temperature dependence of the magnetization, indicating a ferromagnetic state induced below T C (around 100 K). The magnetization at 10 K ( M 10 K ) increases with the increase of the sintering temperature, so does T C . As for PCM1300, the shape of the FC curve is slightly altered with a peak superimposed on the ferromagnetic-like curve. M 10 K of this sample is lower than that of the other three samples. T C is also lower than that of PCM900 and PCM1000. Compared with FC magnetization, ZFC ones are rather low and a peak appears at some temperature ( T p ) a little below T C , where FC and ZFC curves show bifurcation. As temperature is decreased further, large difference occurs between FC and ZFC curves. The features indicate the absence of long-range order and the presence of cluster glass state for all the samples below T C [12] . Shown in Fig. 3 are the magnetic hysteresis loops measured at 10 K. All the curves show a well-defined magnetic hysteresis loop, which suggests the existence of a ferromagnetic component. No saturation is found under a magnetic field up to 5 T, consistent with the cluster glass behavior. All the phenomena can be well interpreted by a model that ferromagnetic clusters embed in antiferromagnetic matrix [13] . The coercivity ( H c ) decreases with the increase of sintering temperature, coinciding with the fact of increasing D ( Table 1 ). The T C , T p , and M 10 K , together with H c at 10 K of all the samples, are listed in Table 1 . When doping Pr for Ca in CaMnO 3 , Mn 3+ ions are created due to charge balance. Double exchange interaction is therefore introduced between Mn 3+ and Mn 4+ , resulting in ferromagnetic coupling. In contrast, Mn 4+ , the majority in the materials, forms an antiferromagnetic matrix dominated by the Mn 4+ –Mn 4+ superexchange interaction, in which ferromagnetic clusters distributed randomly. This can be verified by the asymmetry of the M – H behavior of all the samples ( Fig. 3 ), which is caused by the exchange bias effect, and is usually found in ferromagnetic/antiferromagnetic mixed systems. The competition between ferromagnetic and antiferromagnetic component contributes to the cluster glass state at low temperature. Field cooling aligns the clusters, which leads to the onset of a relatively large ferromagnetic-type magnetization, while ZFC freezes the clusters in random orientations, resulting in the large difference between FC and ZFC curves. The nonstoichiometry of oxygen and manganese occurs during the sintering process in air. As is known, nonstoichiometry usually creates vacancies in perovskites, which changes the ratio of Mn 3+ /Mn 4+ . The sintering temperature increasing from 800 to 1000 °C leads to larger nonstoichiometry and more e g electrons (Mn 3+ ) in the samples, as shown in Table 1 . e g electrons favors the ferromagnetic state, so that M 10 K and T C increase. As sintering temperature rises further to 1300 °C, the concentration of e g electron becomes so high that localization of electrons or local charge ordering appears [9,10] ; hence ferromagnetism is suppressed, and M 10 K and T C decrease simultaneously. The increasing antiferromagnetic component contributes to its FC curve, which exhibits both ferromagnetic and antiferromagnetic features. In order to further determine the cluster glass state at low temperature, the ac magnetic susceptibility of PCM900 and PCM1300 is measured. PCM900 is a representative of 800–1000 °C sintered samples for the similarity of their FC–ZFC curves. Fig. 4 shows the temperature dependence of the ZFC ac susceptibility for PCM900 ( Fig. 4 (a)) and PCM1300 ( Fig. 4 (b)) measured at 51, 1001, 5002, and 9997 Hz, where χ ′( T ) and χ ″( T ) are the in-phase and out-of-phase components, respectively. For PCM900, a sharp peak appears at around 100 K, and another round peak appears at about 67 K on the χ ′( T ) and χ ″( T ) curves. As frequency increases, the peaks on χ ′( T ) shift to high temperature, and the intensity decreases. For PCM1300, the two peaks feature remains on the χ ′( T ) and χ ″( T ) curves. Compared with PCM900, the high-temperature peak is frequency independent and shows higher intensity, while the low-temperature peak is less frequency dependent and exhibits lower intensity, which is not enough to give the position, as shown in the inset of Fig. 4 (b). This feature indicates cluster glass state for both samples. The peaks around 100 K correspond to paramagnetic–ferromagnetic and paramagnetic–antiferromagnetic transition, for T C = T N in Pr 0.1 Ca 0.9 MnO 3 [4] . The peaks around 67 K signal the freezing of ferromagnetic clusters [4] . The frequency dependence of the peaks on χ ′( T ) can be fitted by the well-known expression: (1) τ = τ 0 ( T f - T g T g ) - z υ where τ ∝(1/2 πf ) ( f is the measuring frequency), τ 0 is the characteristic time scale for the spin dynamics, T f the freezing temperature of glass and T g the critical temperature for glass ordering (this is equivalent to the f →0 value of T f ). For PCM900, the amplified drawing and the fitting of the peak around 67 K is shown in Fig. 5 , with zν =4.754, τ 0 =1.2×10 −12 s and T g =66.78 K. The zν and τ 0 values are not in the range of spin-glass systems (5< zν <11, τ 0 ∼10 −13 s) [14,15] , consistent with the cluster glass nature mentioned above. It is noteworthy that the peak around 100 K is also frequency dependent. At the crossover between spin glass and cluster glass, a similar phenomenon is observed [13,16] . Therefore, it could be ascribed to the size of clusters. As shown in Table 1 , when the sintering temperature increases to 1000 °C, the concentration of Mn 3+ ions increases, hence more ferromagnetic clusters are created. As the sintering temperature increases to 1300 °C, higher Mn 3+ concentration converts some ferromagnetic clusters to antiferromagnetic ones. Consequently, the peak around 100 K on the χ ″( T ) curve for PCM1300 exhibits frequency independence. Less amount of ferromagnetic clusters gives higher intensity of the peak around 100 K and a lower intensity for the one at about 67 K. As indicated from the phase diagram of Pr 1− x Ca x MnO 3 [4] , around x =0.9, the decrease of x increases the amount of antiferromagnetic component and converts the system to the antiferromagnetic state eventually. As for the present system, the variation of sintering temperature from 800 to 1300 °C decreases Mn 4+ concentration from 0.87 to 0.81. The ferromagnetic component increases first and decreases later. This fits the trend from the phase diagram; however, the crossover (near x =0.81, PCM1300) is different. It can be interpreted by the effect of defects. Nonstoichiometry of oxygen and manganese breaks the long-range Mn–O–Mn interaction, which hinders the formation of the long-range antiferromagnetic state and keeps the system in cluster glass state when x is as low as 0.81. 4 Conclusion The charge carrier concentration in electron-doped manganites (nominal composition: Pr 0.1 Ca 0.9 MnO 3 ) has been adjusted successfully by changing the sintering temperature. All the samples exhibit cluster glass behavior at low temperature. When the sintering temperature increases, the ferromagnetic component increases first, then decreases at 1300 °C, fitting the trend on the phase diagram. The departure from the phase diagram could be explained by the fact that nonstoichiometry breaks long-range Mn–O–Mn interaction. akwRn0CO.title: The phase transition in PrGa0.95Mg0.05O3 at elevated temperatures
akwRn0CO.abstract: PrGa0.95Mg0.05O3 was synthesized by a standard solid-state technique, having an orthorhombic structure determined from X-ray diffraction (XRD) data at room temperature. At high temperature, an inflection is found on the Ln σT vs. 1/T curve at about 550 °C. The inflection can also be observed on thermal expansion vs. temperature curve at about 530 °C. Furthermore, the number of Raman modes between 200 and 400 cm-1 decreases and the peak at about 190 cm-1 weakens at about 450 °C. The results indicate a structural transition from orthorhombic to tetrahedral or rhombohedral. © 2008 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

14jHqR8R.title: Effect of doping Zn on the magnetoresistance of polycrystalline Sr2FeMoO6
14jHqR8R.abstract: Polycrystalline Sr 2 Fe 1− x Zn x MoO 6 (0 ≤ x ≤ 0.2) compounds with ordered double perovskite structure were fabricated and their magnetic, and magnetoresistance properties were systematically investigated. The X-ray powder diffraction refinements show that the degree of cationic order decreases gradually with increasing Zn content. A great enhancement of low field magnetoresistance and saturated magnetoresistance curves near 1 T are achieved in Zn doped samples. Analysis of the magnetization curves indicates that the doped Zn 2+ ions may easily occupy the abnormal Fe sites and destroy the antiferromagnetic Fe–O–Fe anti-site defects, and so the magnetoresistance under high field was strongly suppressed. PACS 73.43.Qt 75.30.-m 75.30.Kz Keywords Magnetoresistance Magnetic order 1 Introduction The double perovskite Sr 2 FeMoO 6 (SFMO) are being intensively investigated nowadays due to the finding of large magnetoresistance (MR) at room-temperature [1] . The ferromagnetic order of localized Fe 3+ ions can be achieved through the mediation of itinerant conduction electrons of Mo 5+ ions [2] . Its high Curie temperature above 400 K and half-metallic nature make SFMO become an ideal candidate to be used in magnetoelectronics [1,3] . The low field MR (LFMR) is commonly considered to arise from the spin-dependent scattering at grain boundary [4] . Meanwhile, Garia-Hernandezs et al. pointed out that the anti-site defects in SFMO have great influence on the MR [5] . The anti-site defects, which are the partial Fe(Mo) ions misplaced at Mo(Fe) sites, also commonly cause the reduction of the saturated magnetic moment pre formula unit of bulk SFMO [5–8] . The small value of MR only at high field in single crystalline SFMO may originate from the anti-site defects [9] , because the antiferromagnetically coupled Fe–O–Fe pairs at anti-site defects will be progressively aligned with increasing magnetic field. A lot of investigations on cationic doping at both Sr and Mo sites have been done in order to explore the influence of doping on MR in SFMO [10–12] . But the substitution of the Fe site has not been so extensively studied. It is well known that the magnetic structure, especially the anti-site defects, can be changed notably by doping at Fe site, thus the work about substitution of Fe ion should be more helpful for understanding the correlation between magnetic structure and magnet-transport in SFMO. Some works, such as doping Cr, V, Mn, Ni, Co, Cu and Al ions at Fe site in SFMO [13–21] , have been reported. Furthermore, both intragrain MR and intergrain MR at low temperature were observed in the Ba 2 Fe 1− x M x MoO 6 (M = Mn, Zn) compacts by Sriti et al. [22] . Therefore, further research about doping at Fe site in SFMO is still necessary to understand the correlation between magnetic structure and MR in this compound. In this paper, the structure, magnetic and magnetoresistance properties of SFMO with Zn doping were detail investigated with a special emphasis and cautions on the role of antiferromagnetic Fe–O–Fe pairs. The doped Zn 2+ ions might easily occupy the abnormal Fe sites and destroy the antiferrimagnetic Fe–O–Fe pairs. Therefore, the MR under high field is suppressed by the disappearance of Fe–O–Fe pairs. 2 Experimental details A series of Sr 2 Fe 1− x Zn x MoO 6 ( x = 0.0, 0.05, 0.1 and 0.2) polycrystalline samples were prepared by conventional solid-state reaction. The mixture of high purity SrCO 3 , Fe 2 O 3 , ZnO and MoO 3 was pressed into pellets and calcined in air at 900 °C for 5 h. The pellets were then reground, pressed and reheated with sintering at 1200 °C for 5 h in a stream of 1.8% H 2 /N 2 . X-ray diffraction powder patterns were collected using a Bede D 1 XRD spectrometer with Ni-filtered Cu Kα radiation. The room-temperature XRD patterns were refined by the Rietveld method using the program FULLPROF [23,24] . Resistivity was measured using a DC four-probe method and magnetization measurement was carried out using the physical properties measurement system (PPMS) of quantum design. 3 Results and discussion Room-temperature XRD patterns reveal that a single double perovskite phase is obtained. Detailed Rietveld analysis of the XRD patterns has also been done using FULLPROF program. The experimental and calculated XRD patterns as well as their difference for x = 0.1 are shown in Fig. 1 . Refinements using the tetragonal I 4/ mmm space groups lead to the smallest quality-of-fit parameters ( R Bragg = 3.5), as found for SFMO [12] . Other XRD patterns were also well refined using the same space group. The degree of cationic disorder p , which is defined as the fraction of Fe(Mo) ions misplaced at Mo(Fe) sites, can be calculated from the refinement of XRD patterns [9] . The value of p increases from 5 to 10% with x increasing from 0 to 15%, which is shown in the inset of Fig. 1 , suggesting that the number of anti-site defects increases with increasing Zn content. It is well known that t he order of B ′/ B ″sublattice will increase with increasing the charge difference between B ′ and B ″ sites in A 2 B ′ B ″O 6 [12,18] . However, several reports have a little difference with this viewpoint. For example, in the Sr 2 Fe 1− x Cu x MoO 6 samples, the cationic order decreases firstly with Cu 2+ content increasing from 0 to 15% and then increases with further increase of Cu 2+ content [18] ; and large cationic disorder on the B ′/ B ″ sites induced by Zn substitutions for Fe was also observed in Ba 2 FeMoO 6 by Sriti et al. [22] . Therefore, it is not occasional that the degree of cationic order decreases from 95 to 90% with Zn increasing from 0 to 15%, and then increases with increasing Zn content. The value of saturated magnetic moment per formula unit ( M S ) of bulk SFMO is sensitive to the number of anti-site defects. The dependence of M S of pure SFMO on p is well described as M S = (4 − 8 p ) μ B , which agrees with the experimental data [6] and the Monte Carlo computation [7] based on the assumption of the antiferromagnetic coupling of Fe–O–Fe and no magnetic coupling in Mo–O–Mo. According to the equation of Fe 3+ + Mo 5+ → M 2+ + Mo 6+ , the doped Zn 2+ ions can induce the formation of Mo 6+ . So the nonmagnetic Zn 2+ –O–Mo 6+ pairs may exist in SFZMO. There are only two possible states for doped Zn ions at Fe site. In one case, all Zn ions located at the normal Fe site, and thus the value of M S of SFZMO can be given as M S = [(4 − 8 p ) − 4 x ] μ B , where the second term corresponds to the reduction of magnetization due to the formation of nonmagnetic Zn 2+ –O–Mo 6+ pairs. It can be clearly seen from Fig. 2 (open circle) that the calculated value is smaller than the experimental data in this case. In the other case, parts of the doped Zn occupied the abnormal Fe site, such as in the Fe–O–Fe anti-site regions, thereby forming the Fe–O–Zn. The value of M S in SFZMO will be changed to M S =[(4 − 8 p ) − x (4 − 9 p )] μ B , where the second term accounts for the lowering of magnetic moment due to the doped Zn 2+ ions. The calculated values of M S are also shown in Fig. 2 (open square). The agreement between the experimental and the estimated data is remarkably good. It is worth indicating that the doped Zn 2+ ions might easily occupy the abnormal Fe sites and destroy the antiferromagnetic Fe–O–Fe pairs. Fig. 3 shows the normalized magnetization curve of the sample of x = 0.15 at 5 K and up to 5 T. The normalized magnetization curves of SFZMO can be fitted by using the following expression [25] : M ( H )/ M S = (1 − α )[1 − exp(− H / H S )] + α tanh( BH / T ) where the first term stands for the contribution of ferromagnetic-coupled and the second mainly arises from the Fe–O–Fe antiferromagnetic pairs. Thus the prefactor α mainly refers to the fraction of antiferromagnetic interaction and H S is the saturated magnetic field. The experimental data is fitted excellently by this equation, as shown in Fig. 3 . Other samples have similar features, and the variations of α and H S with x are shown in the inset of Fig. 3 . When all of the doped Zn ions located at the normal Fe site, much more Fe–O–Fe pairs will be created with decreasing degree of cationic order, thus the value of α should increase with increasing Zn content. The reduction of α from 16% at x = 0 to 11% at x = 0.2 indicates that the contributions of antiferromagnetic to total magnetic moment decreases monotonously with increasing Zn content, which suggests that the number of antiferromagnetic Fe–O–Fe pairs is reduced by Zn doping. This result is well consistent with the earlier analysis that the antiferrimagnetic Fe–O–Fe pairs are destroyed by the doped Zn 2+ ions. The value of H S decreases gradually from 670 Oe at x = 0 to 530 Oe at x = 0.2, which means that the magnetic field for aligning the ferromagnetic domains was reduced progressively with Zn doping. The forming of Mo–O–Zn–O–Mo chains with no magnetic interaction can divide the ferromagnetic Fe–O–Mo domains into some smaller ferromagnetic ones, thus the saturated magnetic field H S of SFZMO was reduced. Fig. 4 shows the field dependence of MR for SFZMO at 5 K, where the MR was defined as: MR(%) = 100% × [ ρ (0) − ρ ( H )]/ ρ (0); ρ (0) and ρ ( H ) are the resistivity under zero field and external field H , respectively. The LFMR of SFMO was enhanced remarkably by Zn doping. Based on the analysis of magnetic structure, the relationship between the MR and magnetic field can be generally described as: MR( H )= c [1 − exp(− H / H S )] 2 + d tanh( BH / T ), where the first term represent the LFMR arising from the spin-dependent scattering that had been demonstrated by Xiao et al. [26] , and the second term describes the MR under high field originating from the antiferromagnetic Fe–O–Fe pairs. The value of c and d refer to the MR under low and high field, respectively. This equation works very well for representing the experimental data, as shown in Fig. 4 . The variation of H S obtained from the fitting of the MR( H ) curves (not shown in this paper) has similar tendency with that obtained from the fitting of M ( H ) curves (as shown in the inset of Fig. 3 ). This result also means that there are strong correlation between the magnetic structure and magnet-transport in SFZMO compounds. The variations of c and d with x obtained from the best fits are shown in the inset of Fig. 4 . It is found that the value of c increases from 18.6% at x = 0 to 34% at x = 0.15, and then decreases little, while the value of d decreases gradually with increasing Zn content. The above analysis of magnetic structure shows that the doped nonmagnetic Zn ions will lead to the formation of the nonmagnetic and insulated Mo–O–Zn–O–Mo chains, which can divide the large ferromagnetic regions into many smaller ones and acts as barriers for spin-dependent scattering. Therefore, the LFMR will be enhanced remarkably because the smaller magnetic moments become more sensitive to the field [20] . It was worth mentioning that the MR curves of x > 0.1 almost saturate near 1 T, just as the field dependence of magnetization curves at 5 K (as shown in Fig. 3 ). The degree of cationic order of SFMO is as high as 95%, but the MR curve does not turate up to 5 T. This suggests that a little number of antiferromagnetic Fe–O–Fe pairs may influence dramatically the MR at high field because the Fe–O–Fe pairs will be progressively aligned with increasing magnetic field. Serrate et al. pointed out that the MR value of double perovskite Ba 1.6 Sr 0.4 FeMoO 6 can be saturated only above 40 T [27] . The saturated MR curves of x > 0.1 near 1 T can be explained by the disappearance of antiferromagnetic Fe–O–Fe pairs after Zn doping. With the doped Zn ions occupy the abnormal Fe sites and destroy the antiferromagnetic Fe–O–Fe pairs, the magnetic field for aligning the antiferromagnetic pairs will decrease. Thus the MR curves easily saturate at low field, and the MR which origins from the antiferromagnetic Fe–O–Fe is suppressed by doped Zn ions. Moreover, both intragrain MR and intergrain MR were observed in Ba 2 FeMoO 6 with Zn doping, and the remarkable intergrain MR at low temperature was attributed to the modifications of grain boundary after Zn doping [22] . However, though the effect of grain boundary on the measured resistivity cannot be avoided for polycrystalline sample, the change of grain boundary after Zn doping may be omitted in our samples because all samples were prepared by the same process and there is no other phase detected in our XRD profiles. Therefore, the variation of MR in our samples should originate from the change of magnetic structure of SFMO after replacing partial Fe ions by Zn ions, which is similar to that of doping nonmagnetic Al ion in SFMO [20] . 4 Conclusion In summary, the structure, magnetic and magnetoresistance properties of SFZMO were studied. The structure refinements show that the degree of cationic order decreases firstly with increasing Zn content and then increases with further increasing Zn content. The magnetic measurement and fitting result reveal that the formation of Mo–O–Zn–O–Mo chains can divide the large ferromagnetic region into many smaller ones and weaken the magnetic interaction among them, and that the creation of antiferromagnetic Fe–O–Fe pairs is suppressed by Zn doping. The smaller magnetic regions with weakened magnetic interaction are more sensitive to the external magnetic field. Therefore, the great enhancement of LFMR and the reduction of MR under high field are achieved by doped Zn ions. Furthermore, the disappearance of antiferromagnetic Fe–O–Fe pairs results in the weak field dependent of MR under high magnetic field.
